column5: I'll bet y'all think this is real damn funny!  ... doncha?    Forecasting 2-4" here today and I blame each and every one of y'all Canadians for this!!!!  Why can't you keep it up there where it belongs???  ... it can't be that hard!
We gotta spread the love man.  RJ  PS Don't worry its still -10 up here for us.
Now that's a real shame.
My heart goes out to ya ,NO really it does
Why should we have all the fun?   Better go our and git yerself a snowshovel, parka an mukluks
So thats where JWL sent it
Git out the toboggan Glen... the neighbours garbage can lid will do....
Glen get the auger out and drill a hole you will think you are up here ice fishing.  LOL  Regards, Sam
Here's my place this morning  muddler
Ok I'll trya a gain.  http://s141.photobucket.com/albums/r66/jkt...nt=IMG_0590.jpg  Anyway, -24 C this morning. Sunny a nd beautiful. 7 foot snow banks. I always remember this in July.  muddler
-10? hahaha it's -19 here without the wind and we've got close to 24inches in the past 4 days!
No sympathy here  Ya don't need to wory about it...keeps the bugs away
That just made my day.

Told you you were becoming more canadian by the minute.  I would have to say the weatherman is preparing you for November Quinte G2G.  Don't let a little baby powder snowfall deter you get out there and show us what a redneck snowman looks like.  BTW do you actually own a snow shovel or you will have to make due with the garden Ho and the spade.
I live up in Sudbury, trust me I would kill for that. We're burried deep and it is way too cold for the start of March.
Glen better go buy some snow tires in case you get some more Wouldn't want you to get stuck in that white powder
Anthrax !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Tape up all the windows and doors,  stay inside and don't come out till we tell you!
guess ya had to wear a shirt  poor buggers probably calling up 911 all day trying to figure out what the funny white stuff was falling from the sky
I'm in hysterics!  That is classic!  Gotta love it when redneck country gets a dusting of white stuff, just don't go trying to suck it up through a straw, ya gunno freeze your nostrils.
Now theres an  idea.BWAAAAHHA
I can see it now...

Whew!!! I'm glad that's over now!... it got really, really bad for a while there with accumulations of a whole inch!!!... and drifting up to an inch and a half in someplaces!!!  ... making it the worst snow storm in 10 yrs. here!  ... but the sun is out, the temps are up to 48*F, and all the snow is gone!!!  Heck!... it even made the news!  http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/29453310
Looks more like a  '' Colorado low  ''  came in for a landing short of Canada...   :whistling:
... and Colorado lows start out as Alberta Clippers!
